Adding style to your maps

A FREE ONLINE SESSION ORGANIZED BY CARTODB

This class is the second class in our Map Academy series. During this 1.5 hour course, you will learn how to style your online maps using the CartoCSS styling language. We will cover some basic skills for designing your maps, including


  • Basic CartoCSS language
  • Styling based on data properties
  • Zoom dependant styling
  • Basic Torque styling

All students will be expected to have completed Online Mapping for Beginners prior to taking part in this course. Expect to begin right where Online Mapping for Beginners left of and so you should have the two required datasets imported and ready to map on your account.

Sign-up, it's free

Online Support

There are three ways to get live help during the streaming event. The first is to use IRC. If you haven't used IRC before you can head over to WebChat and use it by simply creating a nickname. Second, you can use the comment section of the YouTube video. Finally, you are welcome to just Tweet us @CartoDB or follow the hashtag #mapcademy.

Other material

This is only the tip of the iceberg as far as online mapping goes. If you want to keep using CartoDB to learn more skills, you can start doing so immediately by browsing our online tutorials section. After you get the knack of it, start looking at more advanced topics, including CartoDB.js, Leaflet, and Google Maps.
